Jack of All Trades.name: Jack of All Trades
Jack of All Trades.description:
Through advanced schooling, book-learning, computer-enhanced skill programs, or just amazing intuitive perception, your hero has a talent for picking up skills on the fly. There’s little he can’t figure out given a little time and a dash of luck.

The character makes a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} roll as an action after observing or studying some subject. She gains a d4 in the relevant skill with success, or d6 with a raise. She may try again after an hour of study, trial and effort, or immersion if she fails or wants to try for a raise. This lasts until the character attempts to learn a different subject, whether she’s successful or not.

Rabble Rouser.name: Rabble Rouser
Rabble Rouser.description:
This instigator knows how to rile up several enemies at once.

As a limited action, a character with this Edge can make a social @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03test0000000000]{Test} with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation} or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Taunt]{Taunt} against all enemies in a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03areaeffectat00]{Medium Blast Template}. The targets must be able to see and hear the hero clearly. Each defender resists and is affected by the Test separately.

Work the Room.name: Work the Room
Work the Room.description: Your hero’s words don’t just inspire those they’re directed at—they often inspire others as well. As a limited action, you can use Work the Room to roll an additional skill die when @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03support0000000]{Supporting} with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion} or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Performance]{Performance}. The additional die Supports any other ally who can see or hear your hero, and applies to their next action, whatever it may be.

Trademark Weapon.name: Trademark Weapon
Trademark Weapon.description:
The hero knows one unique weapon (Excalibur, Old Betsy, Sting) like the back of his hand. When using it, he adds +1 to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (throwing), @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting}, or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} rolls, and +1 to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Parry} when readied (even if it’s a ranged weapon).

A fighter can take this Edge multiple times, applying it to a different weapon each time. If a Trademark Weapon is lost, he can replace it but the benefits don’t kick in for a few days (however long the GM feels is dramatically appropriate).
Trademark Weapon.requirements: Novice, skill with chosen weapon of d8+

Improved Block.name: Improved Block
Improved Block.description: The hero’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Parry} bonus is now +2 and the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03gangingup00000]{Gang Up} bonus against him is reduced by 2

Improved Counterattack.name: Improved Counterattack
Improved Counterattack.description: The hero gets a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Free Attacks]{Free Attack} against up to three failed attacks each round.

Iron Will.name: Iron Will
Iron Will.description: The hero now adds his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Strong Willed]{Strong Willed} bonus to resist powers and negate their effects. Iron Will doesn’t stack with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Brave]{Brave}, nor does it apply to subse­quent rolls resulting from powers such as being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Shaken} by a damaging @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{power}, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Fear]{fear}, or the like.

Fervor.name: Fervor
Fervor.description:
A simple phrase uttered by a great leader can sometimes have momentous results. A commander with this ability can inspire his troops to bloody fervor by yelling a motto, slogan, or other inspirational words.

@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Wild Cards and Extras]{Extras} in range add +1 to their @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} damage rolls

Master of Arms.name: Master of Arms
Master of Arms.description: Increase the hero’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Parry} an additional +1 and his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} bonus damage die is now a d10.

Great Luck.name: Great Luck
Great Luck.description: The player draws two extra @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03bennies0000000]{Bennies} instead of one at the start of each session.

Combat Reflexes.name: Combat Reflexes
Combat Reflexes.description: Your warrior recovers quickly from shock and trauma. He adds +2 to his rolls when attempting to recover from being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Shaken} or @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03stunned0000000]{Stunned}

Charismatic.name: Charismatic
Charismatic.description: Your hero is likable for some reason. She may be trustworthy or kind, or might just exude confidence and goodwill. You get one free reroll on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion} rolls.

Rapid Fire.name: Rapid Fire
Rapid Fire.description: The shooter is practiced at taking quick and accurate shots. As long as she’s armed with a fast-firing ranged weapon of some sort (such as a revolver or semi-automatic) and has enough ammunition to do so, she may increase her weapon’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Rate of Fire]{Rate of Fire} by 1 for any one of her @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} attacks that turn.

Brawler.name: Brawler
Brawler.description:
His fists hit like hammers or his talons cut like scythes. His body feels like it’s made of stone. Brawlers increase their @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Toughness} by 1 and roll @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength} +d4 when hitting with their fists or feet (or claws if they have them). If they already have a damage die from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Special Ability (Claws)]{Claws}, the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Martial Artist]{Martial Artist} Edge, etc., increase the damage die type by one instead.

The Brawler Edge doesn’t make the character’s fists @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Natural Weapons]{Natural Weapons}

Improved Rapid Fire.name: Improved Rapid Fire
Improved Rapid Fire.description:
The shooter may now increase her weapon's @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Rate of Fire]{Rate of Fire} by 1 twice in the same turn (via a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03multiactions00]{Multi-Action})

Example

Gabe fires a machine gun and has Improved Rapid Fire. The weapon has a Rate of Fire of 4 and Gabe decides to fire it on all three of his allowed actions (see Multi-Actions).

He rolls an extra @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} die with his first and second attack, raising the weapon’s Rate of Fire to 5 each time. He doesn’t get the bonus on his third attack—the machine gun’s Rate of Fire remains a 4.

Harder To Kill.name: Harder To Kill
Harder To Kill.description: Your hero is tougher to kill than Rasputin. If he is ever “killed,” roll a die. On an odd result, he’s dead as usual. On an even roll, he’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Incapacitated} but somehow escapes death. He may be captured, stripped of all his belongings, or mistakenly left for dead, but he somehow survives.

Danger Sense.name: Danger Sense
Danger Sense.description:
Your hero can sense when something bad is about to happen. When rolling for @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03surprise000000]{Surprise}, he adds +2 to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Notice]{Notice} roll to act in the first round. With a raise, he starts the encounter on @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03hold0000000000]{Hold}.

In other situations not covered by the Surprise rules (a sniper shot, pit trap, poisoned drink, etc.), Danger Sense gives him a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Notice]{Notice} roll at −2 (or +2 if a Notice roll is usually allowed) to detect the hazard and take appropriate action. If this was an attack and the hero makes his Notice roll, the foe doesn’t get @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03thedrop0000000]{The Drop} against him.

Aristocrat.name: Aristocrat
Aristocrat.description:
This individual was born into privilege or came into it later in life. She may or may not have money (the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Rich]{Rich} or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Filthy Rich]{Filthy Rich} Edge), but she still walks in the elite social circles of the setting.

Aristocrats add +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion} when @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04networking0000]{Networking} with the local elite, captains of industry, nobles, or other aristocrats. They also add +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Common Knowledge]{Common Knowledge} rolls made to know the etiquette of the upper class, recognize family trees or heraldry, or recall gossip concerning others of their station

Common Bond.name: Common Bond
Common Bond.description:
Selfless heroes and determined leaders know their greatest strength often comes from their companions, and are willing to give some of their own fortune, fate, or luck to support them.
A character with this Edge may freely give her @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03bennies0000000]{Bennies} to any other character she can communicate with. The player should explan what form this takes, from a quick shout of encouragement to a welcome pat on the back

Chi.name: Chi
Chi.description:
Your hero’s martial arts training goes beyond the norm and into the realm of the mystical. At the start of each combat encounter, she gains a “Chi Point” that can be spent to:

  • Reroll one of her failed attacks (even a Critical Failure).
  • Make an enemy discard an attack against her, then reroll it from scratch.
  • Add +d6 damage to a successful @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack made with her hands, feet, claws, or other @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Natural Weapons]{Natural Weapons} (this may @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Trait Rolls]{Ace}).

Unspent Chi is lost at the end of the combat encounter.

Frenzy.name: Frenzy
Frenzy.description: A character with Frenzy may roll a second @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} die with any one of his Fighting attacks for the turn. The extra die may be allocated to the same or different targets as he sees fit. Resolve each separately

Arcane Background (Miracles).name: Arcane Background (Miracles)
Arcane Background (Miracles).description:
• Arcane Skill: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Faith]{Faith} (Spirit)
  • Starting @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Powers}: 3
  • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points}: 10

Those who invoke miracles draw their power from a divine presence of some sort, including gods, nature, or spirits. Their powers are usually invoked with a few words of prayer or by performing established rituals.

Those who cast miracles are champions of their particular religions. They typically have @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01hindrances0000]{Hindrances} that pertain to their service, such as @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.Vow]{Vow} or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-hindrances.Obligation]{Obligation}. They might also have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Connections]{Connections} to others of their religion who can help them out when their divine energies wane

Luck.name: Luck
Luck.description:
The adventurer seems to be blessed by fate, karma, the gods, or whatever external forces he believes in (or believe in him!).

He draws one extra @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03bennies0000000]{Benny} at the beginning of each game session, allowing him to succeed at important tasks more often than most, and survive incredible dangers.

Improved Arcane Resistance.name: Improved Arcane Resistance
Improved Arcane Resistance.description:
Magic and the supernatural hold little sway with this individual. Whether by nature, heritage, or training he’s particularly resistant to magic, psionics, weird science, and other supernatural energies.

Arcane skills targeting the hero suffer a -4 penalty (even if cast by allies!) and magical damage is reduced by 4 as well.

Extra Effort.name: Extra Effort
Extra Effort.description:
Some @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Arcane Background (Gifted)]{Gifted} can dig deep into their souls to significantly boost their powers.

Extra Effort increases a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Focus]{Focus} total after it’s rolled by +1 for 1 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Arcane Backgrounds]{Power Point}, or +2 for 3 Power Points. It may not be used to improve a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Critical Failure}.

Professional.name: Professional
Professional.description: The character is an expert at a particular skill or attribute (his choice). This increases the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Trait} and its limit one step (a d12+1 becomes a d12+2, for example). This Edge may be selected once per Trait.
Professional.requirements: Legendary, maximum die type possible in affected Trait

Arcane Resistance.name: Arcane Resistance
Arcane Resistance.description:
Magic and the supernatural hold little sway with this individual. Whether by nature, heritage, or training he’s particularly resistant to magic, psionics, weird science, and other supernatural energies.

Arcane skills targeting the hero suffer a -2 penalty (even if cast by allies!) and magical damage is reduced by 2 as well.

Expert.name: Expert
Expert.description: As the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Professional]{Professional} Edge, increasing the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Trait} and its limit one additional step.

Command Presence.name: Command Presence
Command Presence.description: A booming voice, effective commands, natural charisma, or simple training results in a much more effective combat element. A hero with this Edge has a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edges000000000]{Command Range} of 10″ (20 yards).

Fame.name: Fame
Fame.description:
Your character is a minor celebrity of some sort. She might be a popular bard known in a particular fiefdom, a minor rock star, or a beloved B-movie actor.

She makes double the normal fee when performing for pay (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Performance]{Performance}). She can also use her celebrity to add +1 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion} rolls if a target is friendly and knows who she is (a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Common Knowledge]{Common Knowledge} roll modified by how likely the individual is to know the celebrity).

The downside of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Fame]{Fame} is that the individual is often recognized, others frequently want something from her, she may be followed by fans or admirers, or she may not be able to shirk obligations, performances, or other duties without causing trouble for herself.

Liquid Courage.name: Liquid Courage
Liquid Courage.description:
This gregarious individual processes alcohol far differently than most. The round after consuming a stiff drink (about eight ounces of hard liquor or equivalent), her @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Vigor} increases one die type (increasing @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Toughness} as well). The drinker can also ignore one level of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wound} penalties (which stacks with other abilities that do the same).

@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Agility}, and all linked skills suffer a −1 penalty for the duration, however.

The effect lasts for one hour after it begins, at which point the boozer suffers a level of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03fatigue0000000]{Fatigue} for the next four hours.

Improved First Strike.name: Improved First Strike
Improved First Strike.description: Once per round, as long as he’s not @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Shaken} or @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03stunned0000000]{Stunned}, the hero gets a free @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack against three foes immediately after he moves into @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02reach000000000]{Reach}. (See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Free Attacks]{Free Attacks}).

Arcane Background (Psionics).name: Arcane Background (Psionics)
Arcane Background (Psionics).description:
• Arcane Skill: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Psionics]{Psionics} (Smarts)
  • Starting @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Powers}: 3
  • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points}: 10

Psionicists tap into their own mental energy to manipulate matter, read minds, and far more. Some are agents in the employ of a vast government agency, while others are often on the run from them! Some may have years of training or they might have developed their incredible powers in isolation

Soul Drain.name: Soul Drain
Soul Drain.description:
Desperate times call for desperate measures. Soul Drain allows an arcane character to channel her physical energy into power, taking a level of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03fatigue0000000]{Fatigue} to recover up to five @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points}. She can take an additional level of Fatigue (to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03fatigue0000000]{Exhaustion}) to recover up to five more Power Points. She cannot render herself @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03fatigue0000000]{Incapacitated} in this way.

Fatigue incurred by Soul Drain comes from deep within and may only be recovered naturally. The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Relief]{relief} power and similar abilities have no effect.
Soul Drain.requirements: Seasoned, Arcane Background (Any), arcane skill d10+

Bolster.name: Bolster
Bolster.description: Belittling or humiliating an enemy can also boost your ally’s spirits. When this character successfully @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03test0000000000]{Tests} a foe, he may also remove the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03distractedan00]{Distracted or Vulnerable} state from one of his allies.

Quick.name: Quick
Quick.description:
Quick characters have lightning-fast reflexes and a cool head. Whenever you are dealt an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Action Cards (Initiative)]{Action Card} of Five or lower, you may discard it and draw again until you get a card higher than Five.

@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Characters} with both the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Level Headed]{Level Headed} and Quick Edges first draw their additional card and choose which to take. If that card is a Five or less, the Quick Edge may be used to draw a replacement until it’s Six or higher.

Improvisational Fighter.name: Improvisational Fighter
Improvisational Fighter.description: Heroes often find themselves fighting with pieces of equipment or furnishings not designed for combat. A brawler with this Edge has a knack for using such improvised weapons. He ignores the usual -2 penalty when wielding them. See @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03improvisedwe00]{Improvised Weapons} for more details.

Power Points.name: Power Points
Power Points.description:
Wizards, weird scientists, and other arcane types always want more power. This Edge grants them an additional 5 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Arcane Backgrounds]{Power Points}.

Power Points may be selected more than once, but only once per @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Rank}. It may be taken as often as desired at Legendary Rank, but each grants only 2 additional points.

Healer.name: Healer
Healer.description: A hero with this Edge adds +2 to all @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03healing0000000]{Healing} rolls, whether natural or magical in nature.

New Powers.name: New Powers
New Powers.description:
An arcane character may learn two new @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{powers} by choosing this Edge (which may be taken multiple times). He may choose from any powers of his @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Rank} or lower normally available to his particular @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Arcane Backgrounds]{Arcane Background}.

A character can add a new @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping} on a power she already has instead of gaining a new one. She might add an ice Trapping to her existing fire @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Bolt]{bolt}, for example, so she could switch between ice and fire Trappings freely

Elan.name: Elan
Elan.description: Elan means energy or spirit. Those who have it rise to the occasion when the going gets toughest. When you spend a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03bennies0000000]{Benny} to reroll a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Trait}, add +2 to the total. The bonus applies only when rerolling. It doesn’t apply to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03dealingdamag00]{damage} rolls (since they’re not Trait rolls), nor does it apply to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Soak Rolls]{Soak rolls} unless you’re using another Benny to reroll the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Vigor} check.

Channeling.name: Channeling
Channeling.description: When the character gets a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Trait Rolls]{raise }on her arcane skill roll (or roll to activate or use an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Arcane Devices]{arcane device}), she reduces its @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Arcane Backgrounds]{Power Point} cost by 1. This can take it to 0

Master Tactician.name: Master Tactician
Master Tactician.description: The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Tactician]{Tactician} now gets a total of two extra @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Action Cards (Initiative)]{Action Cards} to distribute each round

Menacing.name: Menacing
Menacing.description: Being a brutish lout isn’t always a drawback if you know how to use it. Menacing allows a character to put her bad looks or worse attitude to good use. The goon adds +2 to her @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation} rolls.
Menacing.requirements: Novice, any one of Bloodthirsty, Mean, Ruthless, or Ugly

Investigator.name: Investigator
Investigator.description:
Investigators spend a great deal of time researching ancient legends, working the streets, or deducing devilish mysteries. Some of these heroes are actual private investigators while others are sleuthing mages in a fantasy world or inquisitive college professors stumbling upon Things Man Was Not Meant to Know.

Investigators add +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Research]{Research} rolls and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Notice]{Notice} rolls made to search through desks for important papers, sift through stacks of junk mail for something of note, or spy obscured items from piles of junk or debris

Mighty Blow.name: Mighty Blow
Mighty Blow.description: If your Action Card is a Joker, double the damage of your first successful @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack this round.

Connections.name: Connections
Connections.description:
Your heroine is connected to people or organizations who can help her when the chips are down. It might be the mob, the Feds, a union, or even other adventurers.
Connections may be taken more than once, selecting a new faction or contact each time. Once per session, and assuming she can get in touch with them, the heroine can call on her friends for a favor.
The favor depends on the nature of the contact (GM’s call), but might include a loan, gear, a few allied fighters, transportation, information, or even a professional with critical skills the party doesn’t have, like a hacker or scholar.

Filthy Rich.name: Filthy Rich
Filthy Rich.description:
This fortunate individual is very wealthy. He has five times the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{starting funds} for the setting during character creation and, if appropriate, a yearly income after responsibilities of around $500,000.

Even wealthier characters may exist, but unless there’s a game effect it probably shouldn’t matter. This should be worked out with the GM and come with many more assets as well as onerous responsibilities

Concentration.name: Concentration
Concentration.description: Through training and focus, the caster is extremely efficient in channeling arcane forces. The base @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Powers} of any non-Instant power is doubled. This includes maintaining powers as well.

Arcane Background (Magic).name: Arcane Background (Magic)
Arcane Background (Magic).description:
• Arcane Skill: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Spellcasting]{Spellcasting} (Smarts)
  • Starting @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Powers}: 3
  • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points}: 10

Magicians range from powerful wizards to vile cultists. They draw on raw supernatural energy to fuel their eldritch fires. This energy infuses the worlds in which they live, and is drawn forth with gestures, words of power, or ancient runes.

Alertness.name: Alertness
Alertness.description: Not much gets by this hero. He’s very observant and perceptive, and adds +2 to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Notice]{Notice} rolls to hear, see, or otherwise sense the world around him.

Rapid Recharge.name: Rapid Recharge
Rapid Recharge.description: @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points} normally recharge at a rate of 5 points every hour spent resting (see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05activation0000]{Recharging}). This Edge increases that rate to 10 every hour.

Tactician.name: Tactician
Tactician.description:
The commander has a natural grasp of small unit tactics and can take advantage of rapidly changing situations.

A Tactician is dealt an extra @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Action Cards (Initiative)]{Action Card} each round of combat or a chase—kept separate from his own cards. At the start of the round, he may discard it or give it to any @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03wildcardsand00]{Extra} (or group of Extras sharing an Action Card) in @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edges000000000]{Command Range}. The player or GM controlling the receiving character can decide whether to accept and replace her current Action Card, or discard it.
Tactician.requirements: Seasoned, Smarts d8+, Command, Battle d6+

Improved Sweep.name: Improved Sweep
Improved Sweep.description:
Improved Sweep allows a character to make a single @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack and apply it against all targets in his @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02reach000000000]{Reach} (friends and foes alike). Resolve damage separately for each enemy that’s hit.

A fighter may only perform a Sweep once per turn. It may not be combined with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Frenzy]{Frenzy}.

Scholar.name: Scholar
Scholar.description:
Learned professors, devoted students, and amateur enthusiasts spend great amounts of time and energy studying particular subjects. They become experts in these fields, and rarely fail to answer questions in their particular area of expertise.

Pick any one of the following skills: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Academics]{Academics}, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Battle]{Battle}, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Occult]{Occult}, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Science]{Science}, or a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts}-based “knowledge”-type skill allowed in your setting, and add +2 to the total whenever they’re used.

This Edge may be taken more than once if applied to different skills.

Holy/Unholy Warrior.name: Holy/Unholy Warrior
Holy/Unholy Warrior.description:
Believers face grave dangers in service to their divine patrons. To survive such hardships, the forces of good (or evil) grant miracles and the ability to turn their favor into supernatural protection.

The chosen may add +1 to the total of a final @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Soak Rolls]{Soak roll} for each @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Point} spent, to a maximum of +4.

Jack-Of-All-Trades.name: Jack-Of-All-Trades
Jack-Of-All-Trades.description:
Through advanced schooling, book-learning, computer-enhanced skill programs, or just amazing intuitive perception, your hero has a talent for picking up skills on the fly. There’s little he can’t figure out given a little time and a dash of luck.

The character makes a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} roll as an action after observing or studying some subject. She gains a d4 in the relevant skill with success, or d6 with a raise. She may try again after an hour of study, trial and effort, or immersion if she fails or wants to try for a raise. This lasts until the character attempts to learn a different subject, whether she’s successful or not.

Ambidextrous.name: Ambidextrous
Ambidextrous.description:
Your warrior is as deft with his left hand as he is with his right. He ignores the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03offhandattac00]{Off-Hand Penalty}

If holding a weapon in each hand, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Ambidextrous]{Ambidextrous} characters may stack @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Parry} bonuses (if any) from both weapons.

Extraction.name: Extraction
Extraction.description:
When a character withdraws from melee, adjacent attackers get a free @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack against him (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Withdrawing From Melee]{Withdrawing From Melee}). This is a very dangerous proposition for most, but not your wily champion.

When moving away from adjacent foes, one of them (player’s choice), doesn’t get his free @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack.

Artificer.name: Artificer
Artificer.description:
Those who tangle with supernatural forces sometimes find ways to imbue powers into items. They may turn an ordinary blade into a magic sword, grant powerful potions to their friends, or even bless holy relics with divine grace.
Artificers can create @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanedevice00]{Arcane Devices} and give them to their allies.

Retort.name: Retort
Retort.description:
This verbal duelist can turn the slings and arrows of social combat right back at the unwitting fools who hurled them.

If a character with Retort gets a raise when resisting an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation} or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Taunt]{Taunt} @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03test0000000000]{Test}, the foe is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Distracted and Vulnerable]{Distracted}.

Two-Fisted.name: Two-Fisted
Two-Fisted.description:
If a character makes a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack withone action and another from a different hand in a later action, the second attack doesn’t inflict a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03multiactions00]{Multi-Action} penalty. The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Off-Hand Attacks]{Off-Hand} penalty still applies unless he’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Ambidextrous]{Ambidextrous}.

If the character has @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Two-Gun Kid]{Two-Gun Kid}, the second action may also be a ranged attack.

Dead Shot.name: Dead Shot
Dead Shot.description: When your @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Action Cards (Initiative)]{Action Card} is a Joker, double the total damage of your first successful @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (throwing) or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} roll this round.
Dead Shot.requirements: Wild Card, Novice, Athletics or Shooting d8+

Champion.name: Champion
Champion.description:
Champions are holy (or unholy) men and women chosen to fight for a particular deity or religion. Most are pious souls ready and willing to lay down their lives for a greater cause, but some may have been born into the role and follow their path with some reluctance.

Champions fight the forces of darkness (or good), adding +2 damage when attacking supernaturally evil (or good if they’re evil) creatures. The bonus applies to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03areaeffectat00]{area effect damage}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03attacks0000000]{ranged attacks}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{powers}, etc.

The GM must decide which foes this bonus applies to, but generally it’s any evil (or good!) creature born of magic or with any supernatural abilities.

Block.name: Block
Block.description: Through hard-fought experience your hero has learned to defend himself in vicious hand-to-hand combat. His @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Parry} increases by +1 and any @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03gangingup00000]{Gang Up} bonus against him is reduced by one

Assassin.name: Assassin
Assassin.description: Assassins are trained killers who know how to kill even the toughest foes. They add +2 to damage rolls when their foe is @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Distracted and Vulnerable]{Vulnerable} or they have @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.The Drop]{The Drop}
Assassin.requirements: Novice, Agility d8+, Fighting d6+, Stealth d8+

Mr. Fix It.name: Mr. Fix It
Mr. Fix It.description: The mechanic adds +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Repair]{Repair} rolls. With a raise, he halves the time normally required to fix something. This means if a particular Repair job says a raise repairs it in half the time, a Mr. Fix It can finish the job in one quarter the time with a raise.

Acrobat.name: Acrobat
Acrobat.description: The Acrobat gets one free reroll on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} totals that involve balance, tumbling, or grappling. It doesn’t affect rolls to interrupt actions, climb, swim, or throw

Sidekick.name: Sidekick
Sidekick.description:
A character who triumphs over evil time and time again becomes an inspiration to others. Eventually, one of these young crusaders may attempt to join the hero in his epic quests.

The hero gains a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Novice Rank} sidekick. The sidekick is a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Wild Cards and Extras]{Wild Card}, starts each session with two @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03bennies0000000]{Bennies}, may @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Advance}, and has abilities that complement his mentor. The player character controls his sidekick just like any other ally, though he may occasionally cause trouble by getting captured, running into danger when he’s not supposed to, and so on. The player should be prepared for his Edge to occasionally become a Hindrance!

If the sidekick dies, he isn’t replaced unless the hero chooses this Edge again. Fortunately, heroes may always spend Bennies for their sidekicks as if she had the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Common Bond]{Common Bond} Edge. Sidekicks must actually take that Edge to do the same for their mentors.

Nerves of Steel.name: Nerves of Steel
Nerves of Steel.description: Your hero has learned to fight on through the most intense pain. He may ignore 1 point of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wound} penalties.

Work the Crowd.name: Work the Crowd
Work the Crowd.description: As @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Work The Room]{Work The Room} but the hero now can @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03support0000000]{Support} another on up to two of her Support actions.

Dodge.name: Dodge
Dodge.description: The hero can anticipate attacks or move erratically under fire. Unless the victim of a surprise attack and taken completely unaware, Dodge subtracts 2 from all @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03attacks0000000]{ranged attacks} made against the character. Dodge does not stack with actual @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Cover and Obstacles]{cover}, however

Natural Leader.name: Natural Leader
Natural Leader.description:
This leader has proven herself time and time again, gaining the respect of all those who fight by her side.

Any Leadership Edge that says it applies only to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03wildcardsand00]{Extras} now applies to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03wildcardsand00]{Wild Cards} as well.

Reliable.name: Reliable
Reliable.description: People know they can depend on your hero when they need assistance. He gets a free reroll on any @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03support0000000]{Support} roll.

Mentalist.name: Mentalist
Mentalist.description:
Constant contact with multiple minds gives these psionic agents an edge when it comes to forcing or resisting mental assaults.

Mentalists add +2 to opposed @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Psionics]{Psionics} rolls, whether they are using their powers against a foe or defending against a rival.

Improved Dodge.name: Improved Dodge
Improved Dodge.description: The hero adds +2 when Evading area effect attacks. See @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03evasion0000000]{Evasion}.

Fleet-Footed.name: Fleet-Footed
Fleet-Footed.description: The hero’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03movement000000]{Pace} is increased by +2 and his @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03movement000000]{running die} increases one step (from d6 to d8, for example)

Steady Hands.name: Steady Hands
Steady Hands.description:
Firing from the back of a horse or moving vehicle is tricky business, but your adventurer has figured it out. She ignores the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03unstableplat00]{Unstable Platform} penalty.

This also helps when running, reducing the usual penalty from -2 to -1 (see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03movement000000]{Movement})

Scavenger.name: Scavenger
Scavenger.description:
Once per encounter the hero may find, “suddenly remember,” or dig up some much-needed piece of equipment, a handful of ammunition, or some other useful device.

The Game Master decides what constitutes an encounter, and has the final word on what can and can’t be found.

Martial Warrior.name: Martial Warrior
Martial Warrior.description: Increase the warrior’s Fighting bonus to +2 and her damage die an additional step.

First Strike.name: First Strike
First Strike.description: Once per round, as long as he’s not @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Shaken} or @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03stunned0000000]{Stunned}, the hero gets a free @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack against a foe immediately after he moves into @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02reach000000000]{Reach}. (See @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Free Attacks]{Free Attacks})

Famous.name: Famous
Famous.description:
Your hero is truly famous. She’s wellknown in a large circle such as a country, a large industry, or a popular medium (film or television, the music industry). She makes 5 × the normal fee when performing and adds +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion} rolls when influencing friendly individuals who know who she is.

The price is higher for the truly @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Famous]{Famous}, too, with more demands on her time, obligations, rivals, scandals, and an inability to operate in crowds without being recognized.

Berserk.name: Berserk
Berserk.description:
Berserkers become wild and nearly uncontrollable when the “red rage” takes them, but
they are deadly killing machines as well!

Immediately after suffering a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wound or a Shaken} result (from physical damage only), your hero must make a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} roll or go Berserk. She can voluntarily fail this check if she likes.

Going Berserk has the following effects:

  • FURY:  The character’s Strength increases a die type and every melee attack must be a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Wild Attack]{Wild Attack}. She cannot use any skills that require wit or concentration (GM’s call). She may scream out threats and use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation}, for example.  
  • ENRAGED:  Adrenaline and rage fuel the berserker’s muscles, adding +2 to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Toughness}. She ignores one level of Wound penalties (this stacks with any other abilities that reduce Wound penalties).  
  • RECKLESS ABANDON:  Anytime a berserker rolls a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03traitrolls0000]{Critical Failure} on a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} check, she hits a random target within range of her attack (not the intended target), friend or foe. If there are no applicable targets, the blow simply misses, smashes nearby objects, etc.

After five consecutive rounds of berserk fury, the hero takes a level of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03fatigue0000000]{Fatigue}. At ten rounds, she takes another level of Fatigue and the rage ends. She may also choose to end her rage at any time by making a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} -2 roll (as a free action; possibly avoiding Fatigue if she manages to end her rage before it’s incurred!). Start the count anew if she goes berserk again, even in the same battle.

Rock and Roll!.name: Rock and Roll!
Rock and Roll!.description: Experienced shooters learn to compensate for the recoil of fully automatic weapons. If a character with this Edge doesn’t move on his turn, he ignores the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03recoil00000000]{Recoil} penalty when firing at a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02rateoffire0000]{Rate of Fire} of 2 or higher.

Martial Artist.name: Martial Artist
Martial Artist.description:
The fighter has trained in basic martial arts. Her fists and feet are weapons (see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03naturalweapo00]{Natural Weapons}) so she’s always considered armed. She adds +1 when striking with them and causes @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength}+d4 damage. If she already has a Strength damage die from the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Special Ability (Claws)]{Claws} racial ability or the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Brawler]{Brawler} Edge, increase the damage a die type.

Martial Artist does not add to damage from other Natural Weapons such as fangs or horns.

Very Attractive.name: Very Attractive
Very Attractive.description: Your hero is drop-dead gorgeous. He increases his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Performance]{Performance} and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion} bonus to +2.

Rabble-Rouser.name: Rabble-Rouser
Rabble-Rouser.description:
This instigator knows how to rile up several enemies at once.

Once per turn, a character with this Edge can make a social @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03test0000000000]{Test} with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation} or
@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Taunt]{Taunt} against all enemies in a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03areaeffectat00]{Medium Blast Template}. The targets must be able to see and
hear the hero clearly. Each defender resists and is affected by the Test separately.

Woodsman.name: Woodsman
Woodsman.description:
Woodsmen are rangers, scouts, and hunters who are more at home in the wilderness than in urban areas. They are skilled trackers and scouts, and know how to live off the land for months at a time.

Woodsmen add +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Survival]{Survival} rolls, and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Stealth]{Stealth} rolls made in the wild (not towns, ruins, or underground).

Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
Weapon Master.description: The warrior increases his @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Parry} by +1 and the bonus damage die for @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} rolls is a d8 instead of a d6 (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Dealing Damage]{Bonus Damage}). He must be armed to gain these benefits, but this includes the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Martial Artist]{Martial Artist} Edge, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor06bestia.JournalEntryPage.06specialabili04]{claws}, or other abilities that count as weapons.

Linguist.name: Linguist
Linguist.description: This world-traveler has an ear for languages. She begins play knowing half her @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} die type in different @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Language]{Language} skills of her choice at d6.

Command.name: Command
Command.description: Command is the basic ability to give clear instructions and support to allies in the thick of battle. Extras in @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01edges000000000]{Command Range} add +1 to their @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Spirit} rolls when attempting to recover from being @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Shaken} and +1 to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Vigor} rolls when attempting to recover from being @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03stunned0000000]{Stunned}.

Soldier.name: Soldier
Soldier.description:
Professional soldiers get used to carrying heavy loads, and enduring harsh conditions. After a few days getting used to their gear (GM’s call), they treat their @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength} as one die type higher when determining @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Gear Notes]{Encumbrance} and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Minimum Strength]{Minimum Strength} to use armor, weapons, and equipment without a penalty. (This stacks with the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Brawny]{Brawny} Edge.)

They also get a free reroll on @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Vigor} rolls made to survive environmental hazards (see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04hazards0000000]{Hazards}).

Arcane Background (Gifted).name: Arcane Background (Gifted)
Arcane Background (Gifted).description:
• Arcane Skill: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Focus]{Focus} (Spirit)
  • Starting @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Powers}: 1
  • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points}: 15

The character has innate abilities that don’t fit into the usual tropes of magic, miracles, or psionics. Their powers may be low-level super powers, divine gifts, or even alien abilities, and are often very unusual or unique for their setting

Bruiser.name: Bruiser
Bruiser.description: The fighter increases his @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Toughness} an additional +1, and the damage caused with his fists or claws another die type.

Improved Level Headed.name: Improved Level Headed
Improved Level Headed.description: Fighters who can keep their cool when everyone else is running for @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03coverandobst00]{cover} make deadly combatants. A hero with this Edge draws two additional @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03actioncardsi00]{Action Cards} in combat and chooses which to use.

Arcane Background (Weird Science).name: Arcane Background (Weird Science)
Arcane Background (Weird Science).description:
• Arcane Skill: @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Weird Science](Smarts)
  • Starting @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Powers}: 2
  • @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05arcanebackgr00]{Power Points}: 15

Weird scientists use strange and powerful inventions beyond the normal technological level of the setting. Such creations might be possible due to super fuels, alien discoveries, or the raw intellect of rare super-geniuses who push the boundaries of science.

A weird scientist’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trappings} must always include the item they’re associated with. The @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Burst]{burst} power might manifest through a magical flamethrower in Deadlands: Weird West , for instance, while “Dr. Gabriel’s Wondrous Restorative Elixir!” is a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Healing]{healing} potion.

Weird scientists must have their devices at hand to activate their powers (but see Jury Rig, below).

Other characters can’t activate the inventor’s creations. They might not understand the strange mechanisms required to make it work, the device might not be “calibrated” or portioned for other users, or it might just “fritz out” for anyone but the creator. While this may seem a bit strange narratively, the “magic”—and the Power Points—come from the inventor so he must be the one to activate it.

Creating devices for others is possible—it just requires an Arcane Device and the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Artificer]{Artificer} Edge .

The inventor can use his devices on others, of course, including administering drinks from his magical elixirs or giving them injections of some miraculous super serum he’s created. If Dr. Gabriel administers his elixir, for example, he rolls to activate the power normally. If he gives someone the bottle to use later, they’ll find it’s lost its potency.

Jury Rig: Weird scientists must usually activate their powers through their assigned device, but they can improvise other ways if needed at a -2 penalty. This requires a decent rationale relative to the setting and the GM’s permission.

 

Example

Gabe is captured by evil aliens and all his equipment is taken. He’s placed in a holding cell and decides he’ll use the overhead lights and whatever the aliens use for electricity to create a makeshift @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Blast]{blast}. The GM agrees this will work, but only once since it will destroy the lights and short out the cell’s energy in the process.

Improved Trademark Weapon.name: Improved Trademark Weapon
Improved Trademark Weapon.description:
The hero knows one unique weapon (Excalibur, Old Betsy, Sting) like the back of his hand. When using it, he adds +2 to his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (throwing), @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting}, or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} rolls, and +2 to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Parry} when readied (even if it’s a ranged weapon).

A fighter can take this Edge multiple times, applying it to a different weapon each time. If a Trademark Weapon is lost, he can replace it but the benefits don’t kick in for a few days (however long the GM feels is dramatically appropriate).

Improved Extraction.name: Improved Extraction
Improved Extraction.description: Up to three foes’ (player’s choice) don’t get attacks when your warrior @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Withdrawing From Melee]{moves out of melee} with them

Ace.name: Ace
Ace.description: Aces are pilots and drivers who have a special affinity with their car, boat, plane, or other vehicle. They ignore two points of penalties to any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Boating]{Boating}, @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Driving]{Driving}, or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Piloting]{Piloting} roll, and may spend @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03bennies0000000]{Bennies} to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03soakrolls00000]{Soak} damage for any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Vehicle Notes]{vehicles} they control or command, using the appropriate Boating, Driving, or Piloting skill instead of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Vigor}. Each success and raise negates a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wound}.

Combat Acrobat.name: Combat Acrobat
Combat Acrobat.description: The tumbler leaps quickly about so that attacks against her are made at -1 as long as she’s aware of the attack, can reasonably move about, and isn’t suffering any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Gear Notes]{Encumbrance} or @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02minimumstren00]{Minimum Strength} penalties.

Brave.name: Brave
Brave.description: Those with this Edge have learned to master their fear, or have dealt with so many horrors they’ve become jaded. These valiant explorers add +2 to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04fear0000000000]{Fear} checks and subtract 2 from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-tables.Fear Table]{Fear Table} results.

Killer Instinct.name: Killer Instinct
Killer Instinct.description: This hero hates losing. He gets a free reroll in any opposed @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03test0000000000]{Test} he initiates

No Mercy.name: No Mercy
No Mercy.description: When this killer spends a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03bennies0000000]{Benny} to reroll damage, he adds +2 to his final total.

Marksman.name: Marksman
Marksman.description: The hero is a natural with ranged weapons. If she doesn’t move in a turn and fires no more than a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Rate of Fire]{Rate of Fire} of 1 as her first action, she may add +1 to an @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} (throwing) or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} roll, or ignore up to 2 points of penalties from @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Called Shots]{Called Shots}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03coverandobst00]{Cover}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range}, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03sizeandscale00]{Scale}, or @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03speed000000000]{Speed}. This is a lesser version of the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03aim00000000000]{Aim} maneuver and does not stack with it. Marksman doesn’t apply to additional attacks after the first.
Marksman.requirements: Seasoned, Athletics d8+ or Shooting d8+

Improved Nerves of Steel.name: Improved Nerves of Steel
Improved Nerves of Steel.description: The hero ignores two points of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wound} penalties.

Streetwise.name: Streetwise
Streetwise.description:
Streetwise characters know how to find the local black market, fence stolen goods, avoid the local law (or criminal element!), lay low when the heat’s on, obtain illegal weapons, find out which “boss” is hiring muscle, or similar shady activities.

Streetwise characters add +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Intimidation]{Intimidation} or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Persuasion]{Persuasion} rolls made to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04networking0000]{Networking} with shady or criminal elements.

They also add +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Common Knowledge]{Common Knowledge} rolls pertaining to the types of disreputable activities listed above

Giant Killer.name: Giant Killer
Giant Killer.description:
The bigger they are, the harder they are to kill. At least for most. Your hero knows how to find the weak points in the most massive of foes.

He adds +1d6 damage when attacking creatures who are three or more Sizes larger than himself (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Size and Scale]{Size}). A human (Size 0) gets the bonus against a creature of Size 3 or greater.

Fast Healer.name: Fast Healer
Fast Healer.description: Those with this blessing add +2 to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Vigor} rolls for natural healing, and check every three days instead of five (see @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Healing]{Healing}).

Hard To Kill.name: Hard To Kill
Hard To Kill.description: This adventurer has more lives than a herd of cats. He may ignore his @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Wound} penalties when making @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Vigor} rolls to avoid @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Bleeding Out}.

Free Runner.name: Free Runner
Free Runner.description:
Your character practices “parkour” or is just very skilled at running, jumping, swinging, scampering up walls, and over obstacles.

As long as there are obstacles she can bound on, bounce off, or swing on, she moves at her full @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03movement000000]{Pace} on @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03movement000000]{Difficult Ground} when on foot. She also adds +2 to her @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} rolls when climbing and in foot Chases (see @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04chasesandveh00]{Chases and Vehicles}).

Calculating.name: Calculating
Calculating.description: A few seconds to study your foe’s actions gives your hero a major advantage. When his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Action Cards (Initiative)]{Action Card} is a Five or less, he ignores up to 2 points of penalties on one action that turn, which can include @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03multiactions00]{Multi-Action}, cover, @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range}, and even @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03damageeffect00]{Wound} penalties

Double Tap.name: Double Tap
Double Tap.description:
Experienced firearms experts fire two shots in rapid succession without spoiling their aim.

Double Tap can only be used with weapons that have a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02rateoffire0000]{Rate of Fire} of 1 and can fire two shots without needing to manually @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02reload00000000]{reload}. It adds +1 to hit and damage at the cost of one extra bullet. This is per action, so a shooter can Double Tap more than once if she performs a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03multiactions00]{Multi-Action}.

Double Tap cannot be combined with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Rapid Fire]{Rapid Fire}.

If used with a weapon capable of @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Three-Round Burst]{Three-Round Burst}, it adds +2 to @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} and damage instead of +1 and expends six bullets.

Provoke.name: Provoke
Provoke.description:
Clever characters can manipulate their foes, drawing enemy focus on themselves to protect their allies. Once per turn, when your hero uses @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Taunt]{Taunt} for a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03test0000000000]{Test} and gets a raise, she may @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Provoke]{Provoke} the foe.

In addition to all the usual effects of the success and raise, the enemy suffers a -2 penalty to affect any other target besides the one who provoked her. This stacks with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Distracted and Vulnerable]{Distracted} but not further instances of Provoke.

Provoke lasts until a Joker is drawn, someone else Provokes the target, or the encounter ends. Provoke can affect multiple targets, and may be combined with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Rabble-Rouser]{Rabble-Rouser}.

Tough As Nails.name: Tough As Nails
Tough As Nails.description: Your character keeps going when others fall. She can take four @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wounds} before she’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Incapacitated} (her maximum Wound penalty is still −3).

Wizard.name: Wizard
Wizard.description:
Magic is varied and wonderful, and wizards are exposed to countless tomes, scrolls, and incantations as they master their craft. Sometimes they use this knowledge to recall variations of their various enchantments.

A Wizard can spend 1 extra @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Arcane Backgrounds]{Power Point} when casting a power to change its @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Trapping}. A fireball (@Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Blast]{blast}) might manifest as a lightning bolt, for example. This can often have important consequences if a foe has a particular resistance or weakness to the spell’s usual Trapping

Followers.name: Followers
Followers.description:
Each time this Edge is chosen, five followers come to fight by the hero’s side. If any are lost, others eventually take their place (how long is up to the GM and the circumstances).

Followers must be cared for and generally want a share of whatever loot, treasure, or other rewards the hero acquires. Otherwise, they are completely dedicated to their task. They won’t throw their lives away but are willing to risk them repeatedly in his service.

Use the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-bestiary.Soldier]{Soldier} profile for the followers. A hero may outfit her allies as she sees fit. Followers @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Advance} just like player characters.

Use the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor04theadv.JournalEntryPage.04allies00000000]{Allies} rules  to give them distinctive personal­ities if desired.

Two-Gun Kid.name: Two-Gun Kid
Two-Gun Kid.description:
Two-Gun Kid works just like @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Two-Fisted]{Two-Fisted}, but with ranged weapons, allowing her to fire or throw a weapon in each hand as two different actions but without triggering a@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03multiactions00]{Multi-Action} penalty.

If the character has Two-Fisted, the second action may also be a melee attack.

Example

Red has a sword in one hand and a pistol in the other. She has both Two-Fisted and Two-Gun Kid, so she can make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack on one action and then a second Fighting or @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Shooting]{Shooting} attack with no @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03multiactions00]{Multi-Action} penalty on a later action that turn

Tougher Than Nails.name: Tougher Than Nails
Tougher Than Nails.description: The hero can take up to five @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Wounds} before she’s @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Damage Effects]{Incapacitated}! Her maximum Wound penalty is still −3.
Tougher Than Nails.requirements: Legendary, Tough as Nails, Vigor d12+

McGyver.name: McGyver
McGyver.description:
A McGyver can improvise a device from common resources when the need arises. Given a few simple items, he can make a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Repair]{Repair} roll to craft improvised weapons, explosives, or tools, that last until used or the end of the encounter (GM’s call). This takes one entire turn, and he can’t move or take any other actions while constructing the device.

Failure means the device isn’t ready. A @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Trait Rolls]{Critical Failure} means he doesn’t have the right materials and can’t create the device this encounter.

Success creates a minor explosive (2d4 explosive in a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03areaeffectat00]{Small Blast Template}), a one shot projectile weapon like a “zip gun” (@UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Range} 5/10/20, Damage 2d6), rickety raft, electrical source, etc.

A raise creates a larger explosive (2d6 in a Medium Blast Template or 2d4 in a Large), a better ranged weapon (five shots, 2d8 damage, Range 10/20/40), a more stable raft, a more powerful battery, etc.

The quality or power of the creation is completely up to the Game Master, but creativity should be rewarded, particularly in the most dire and dramatic situations.
McGyver.requirements: Novice, Smarts d6+, Notice d8+, Repair d6+

Feint.name: Feint
Feint.description: When performing a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03test0000000000]{Test} with the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} skill, you can choose to make the foe resist with @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Smarts} instead of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Agility}.

Power Surge.name: Power Surge
Power Surge.description: The character recovers 10 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Arcane Backgrounds]{Power Points} when his @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Action Cards (Initiative)]{Action Card} is a Joker. This may not exceed his usual limit
Power Surge.requirements: Wild Card, Novice, Arcane Background (Any), arcane skill d8+

Brute.name: Brute
Brute.description:
Brutes focus on core strength and fitness over coordination and flexibility. They treat @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Athletics]{Athletics} as linked to @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Strength} instead of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Agility} for purposes of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Advancement}. The character may also resist Athletics @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03test0000000000]{Tests} with Strength if she chooses.

Finally, Brutes increase the @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02range000000000]{Short Range} of any thrown item by +1. Double that for the adjusted Medium Range, and double again for Long Range. If a thrown item’s Range is 3/6/12, for example, a Brute’s Range is 4/8/16.

Hold the Line!.name: Hold the Line!
Hold the Line!.description: Hold the Line strengthens the will of any @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Wild Cards and Extras]{Extras} under the hero's command, adding +1 to their @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{Toughness}.

Humiliate.name: Humiliate
Humiliate.description:
Those with a cruel wit can destroy a rival’s ego in a single remark or well-timed gesture.
Your hero gets a free reroll on @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Taunt]{Taunt Tests}

Gadgeteer.name: Gadgeteer
Gadgeteer.description:
Some mechanical gurus can build incredible devices out of most anything.

A Gadgeteer can spend up to three @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Arcane Backgrounds]{Power Points} to “jury rig” a device from any reasonable collection of spare parts. This allows her to activate any @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{power} normally available to Weird Scientists of her @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Rank} or lower in her particular setting, with a Power Point cost of 3 or lower.

The total cost of an individual power (plus any modifiers) cannot exceed the points spent to create it, nor can the inventor apply @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05trappings00000]{Limitations} to the gadget. She may attempt to create multiple devices as long as she has the points to do so.

Each gadget is created and activated with a @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Weird Science]{Weird Science}} roll at –2. This takes one entire turn, during which she can do nothing else (she cannot take @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03multiactions00]{Multi-Actions} that turn). In all other ways, it works as the normal activation of a power.

The inventor uses Power Points directly from her pool for the device, but once its initial @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05powers00000000]{Duration} is finished (it cannot be maintained) it falls apart into its component pieces.

Example

Gabe is an inventor in the Weird West. He wants to use @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Boost/Lower Trait]{boost Trait} to help Red fight a giant rattlesnake, but only has the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Burst]{burst} and @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-powers.Blast]{blast} powers. Fortunately, he’s a Gadgeteer, so Gabe can put boost Trait into an “electrical bio-inducer.” The device can take up to three points worth of powers, so he adds the @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Hinder or Hurry (+1)]{Hurry} modifier and gives Red +2 @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03movement000000]{Pace} as well
Gadgeteer.requirements: Seasoned, Arcane Background (Weird Science), Weird Science d6+

Improved Frenzy.name: Improved Frenzy
Improved Frenzy.description:
The fighter may roll an extra @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} die with up to two Fighting attacks in the same turn

Example

Red desperately attacks a giant crab-like creature on an alien planet. She has Improved Frenzy and decides to attack three times (a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03multiactions00]{Multi-Action} at the usual penalty). She rolls her Fighting skill with an extra die for her first attack and second attack. She doesn’t get the extra die on her third Fighting roll.

Improved Rapid Recharge.name: Improved Rapid Recharge
Improved Rapid Recharge.description: The character now regains 20 @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-rules.Arcane Backgrounds]{Power Points} per hour spent @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor05powers.JournalEntryPage.05activation0000]{resting}.

Sweep.name: Sweep
Sweep.description:
Sweep allows a character to make a single @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-skills.Fighting]{Fighting} attack and apply it against all targets in his @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor02gear00.JournalEntryPage.02reach000000000]{Reach} at a -2 penalty (friends and foes alike). Resolve damage separately for each enemy that’s hit.

A fighter may only perform a Sweep once per turn. It may not be combined with @Compendium[swade-core-rules.swade-edges.Frenzy]{Frenzy}

Beast Master.name: Beast Master
Beast Master.description:
Animals take to your hero quickly and easily. They won’t attack him unless he attacks them first or they’re enraged for some reason.

The Beast Master’s “animal magnetism” is so great he’s attracted a loyal animal of some sort as well. This is typically an animal of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03sizeandscale00]{Size} 0 or smaller, subject to the GM’s approval. 

The beast is an @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03wildcardsand00]{Extra} and doesn’t @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Advance} in Rank or abilities. If a pet is dismissed or killed, the hero gains a replacement in [[/r 1d4]] days.

More Powerful Companions: Beast Master may be taken more than once. Choose one of the effects below each time it’s chosen:

  • Gain an additional pet.
  • Increase one of the pet’s @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01traits00000000]{Traits} one die type (only one Trait per pet).
  • Increase the maximum Size pet you may have by +1, to a maximum of 3.
  • Make one pet a @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor03rules0.JournalEntryPage.03wildcardsand00]{Wild Card}. (The hero must be of @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01advancement000]{Heroic Rank}).

Rich.name: Rich
Rich.description:
Whether the individual was born with a silver spoon in his mouth or earned it through hard work, he’s got more money than most.

Rich heroes start with three times the normal @UUID[Compendium.swade-core-rules.swade-rules.swadecor01charac.JournalEntryPage.01characters0000]{starting funds} for the setting. If a regular income is appropriate for this setting, the hero receives the modern-day equivalent of a $150,000 annual salary

Brawny.name: Brawny
Brawny.description:
